datoCmsKey.name: Andrea Prestinario
datoCmsKey.bio:
ANDREA PRESTINARIO is an award-winning actress, singer, and activist who is NYC-based and Chicago-grown. She is the Executive Director and Co-Founder of Ring of Keys.

Regional – Baltimore Center Stage: Fun Home (Alison); Weston Playhouse: Fun Home (Alison), Guys & Dolls (Sarah Brown); Asolo Rep: My Fair Lady (Eliza) dir. Frank Galati; Gulshore Playhouse: It's A Wonderful Life: A Live Radio Play; A.C.T. San Francisco: 1776 (Martha) dir. Frank Galati; Paramount Theatre Aurora: RENT (Maureen), My Fair Lady (Eliza); Lyric Opera Chicago: Oklahoma! (Gertie) dir. Gary Griffin; Drury Lane Oakbrook: Gypsy (Louise), Curtains, Sugar, Seven Brides for Seven Brothers; Writers’ Theatre: Oh, Coward!; Boho Theatre Company: Side Show (Violet – Jeff Award, Leading Actress).

Solo show – sMOkeyTOWN: The Songs of Smokey Robinson, produced / conceived / written by Prestinario. Laurie Beechman, Mayne Stage Chicago, Feinstein’s/54 Below, Beverly Arts Center Chicago, Metropolis (Arlington Heights) Arts Center.

Education – BFA Ball State University (Musical Theatre), The School at Steppenwolf.
